website_summaries.verdict: Kids build grammar skills by combining color-coded word cards to create quirky sentences.
pros: Comes with 124 cards color-coded by nouns, verbs, and adjectives
Helps kids learn the parts of speech as well as what makes a complete sentence
cons: May appeal more to the lower end of the age range

customer_reviews.title: Trash product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a similar sentence building game to play with my 5 year old that was a lot of fun. so I wanted to do silly sentences. purchased this but you can only make the same 2 or 3 silly sentences over and over again. this is a complete waste of money, save your money. 5 boards of the same exact words......come on people....
customer_reviews.author: ProckMeister

customer_reviews.title: This game is fun!
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at how heavy this box was! This game came with so many pieces. I purchased this to use in my son's homeschool, (he's 6, 2nd grade), and it did not disappoint! It was a fun learning experience with lots of laughs! Definitely a new favorite! I liked how the puzzle pieces together, too. You can't place a verb with another verb, and so on. It makes constructing sentences very easy and comprehensive. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi Renee Burnett

customer_reviews.title: Buy this now!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent game my sons loved it. Initially my older son didn’t want to play but then he saw how much fun his brother and I were having he decided to join. The game seems pretty sturdy and is holding up very well we’ve had it over a month and play very often. I recommend all parents with little readers purchase
customer_reviews.author: Aa A

customer_reviews.title: Love the silly sentences
customer_reviews.text: I bought these silly sentences for our writing center at home. They are so awesome. They are a great addition to our writing station and homeschooling routine. My son loves them and cracks up over the silly sentences he can create. They are a great addition for homeschooling, Public School teachers, and even just to supplement your child's learning at home as well. I am very happy with the product and will be buying from DK games again.
customer_reviews.author: TLChronicles

customer_reviews.title: Fun and educational.
customer_reviews.text: My autistic son is learning to read because of this'game'. It makes it fun, and it's hands on. His hands and his brain are busy. The puzzle pieces are sturdy. The pictures are real, not cartoon.
customer_reviews.author: mshroyer7

customer_reviews.title: Sneaky Learning
customer_reviews.text: I love games like these where kids are having fun and don't know they're learning. My 5 year old loves laughing over sentences he comes up with, and it's opened the door to talk about parts of speech and to work on reading short sentences. I like that the pieces won't fit unless the sentence makes sense grammatically, and I was impressed that there are so many words included. We've never run out of words to make more sentences. It's been a big hit and a nice addition to homeschool stations.
customer_reviews.author: LH

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't have the word "and" and words will only fit certain ways together.
customer_reviews.text: These are great for beginners I think, but my kids really wanted to make long sentences and to be creative. We made one of the "a" cards into "and" but because the puzzle piece ends aren't all the same, it makes the line messy looking. My kids wanted to be able to say "The crocodile ate the school and house" and since we added "and" it works enough now to satisfy them. Even so, I wish that it had come with conjunctions already.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my nephew as a 6th birthday gift. He opened it and I helped him sort the words by type (though he was able to do it himself once we got going as they are color coded) and he started making sentences right away. He enjoyed reading the silly sentences he had made to everyone. I would definitely recommend this for a child who has basic reading skills.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Just okay.
customer_reviews.text: This game is cute, but not really a game at all. There are a lot of small words that are not included in the game but could make it a lot better. Also when trying to form sentences the words fit together like puzzle pieces and sometimes the pieces don’t fit together even though the words technically do. For the price I think it’s good, but my six-year-old probably will only play with it a few times before she gets bored.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Sansonetti

customer_reviews.title: Got it for my classroom and my students love it. I'm a special education teacher and I ...
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my classroom and my students love it. I'm a special education teacher and I like that it helps students who are not able to write sentences independently have a model. I only wish there were more options (sentence structure is limited), but for the price it is great. I also like that it makes it hard to connect puzzle pieces if the sentence does not make sense (word type has to go in a particular order).
customer_reviews.author: C-Dog

customer_reviews.title: Very Enjoyable and Effective Learning Game
customer_reviews.text: This is a well thought out game for new readers who are ready to learn very basic grammer. The physical quality is also very high. We are keeping the card residue to create other word groups when our grand daughter masters the basic game. The negative forms are made of sturdy card board so we can keep this going for a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun and encourages reading
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is a beginner reader and was struggling because she wasn’t really interested in books on their own or some of the other learn to read games. She really enjoys this and likes to spend a solid hour at a time using all the word pieces and creating sentence after sentence with this fun game!
customer_reviews.author: Holly C

customer_reviews.title: Total Hit!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for my 8 yr old grandson for birthday gift. He is just starting to really like board games and I can never resist ordering something educational for the grand kids. He loves this game as he can play either by himself or with sisters/parents/friends. Really keeps all of them laughing at the silly sentences and makes learning fun!
customer_reviews.author: Grammalammadingdong

customer_reviews.title: Not bad beginner level
customer_reviews.text: Not bad at all for the price. It’s at about a first or K level? My dyslexic daughter likes it, just realize there are only limited word options. I like how the words fit together as puzzle pieces. I might get the more difficult levels.
customer_reviews.author: amazoner

customer_reviews.title: Not silly enough
customer_reviews.text: We have a number of reading games at home and while this one is not a huge favorite, it isn't the worst either. I like the variety of words for my early reader to work on, but you can only make the sentences marginally fun and silly.
customer_reviews.author: H.A.

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a homeschool supplement to help my kiddo with forming complete sentences, word recognition, and using descriptive words. This meets those expectations and it's fun to read the silly sentences she comes up with.
customer_reviews.author: Truth Teller

customer_reviews.title: All verbs are past tense
customer_reviews.text: Great idea and liked the graphics. The lack of a variety of verbs limits what you can create. Have thought about adding some verbs of my own. If I hadn't punch out all the items I would most likely return. Will see if I can donate to a school. Might be better used in a classroom center.
customer_reviews.author: carol

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: Son s as md daughter both love this game. They can’t make sentences that are grammatically incorrect.
customer_reviews.author: Frijol

customer_reviews.title: Make your own. It's cheaper and probably more fun.
customer_reviews.text: Very limited choices for making sentences. First grader might find it fun, but second and older are definitely bored with this game.
customer_reviews.author: TX Florist

customer_reviews.title: Fun for a day
customer_reviews.text: It’s fun but limited. The shapes of the pieces make it impossible to make funny sentences. I assume it is to teach proper sentence format but when we play we feel limited with our choices.
customer_reviews.author: K. Aggson

customer_reviews.title: Fun and versatile!
customer_reviews.text: My kids (10, 7, 3) all LOVE this "game". We don't always use it as a game, sometimes it's just for creating funny writing prompts. Really well made and versatile for our homeschooled family.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Fun & helpful for ages 4-7.
customer_reviews.text: Great and fun product to use and play with your youngster. Encourages creativity and a great learning tool for pre-K.
customer_reviews.author: LALLAW

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: Wish it listed whether the word was a verb or noun etc. Instead of being color coded (with no guide). My kids didn't like it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: An excellent and fun way to teach sentence structure.
customer_reviews.text: My 3rd grade students have so much fun creating silly sentences. If the sentence isn't done correctly the pieces don't fit so it's self-correcting. It's basically a one-sentence completion. It would be very interesting for older kids to make compound sentences, as well.
customer_reviews.author: B2

customer_reviews.title: Game for teaching sentence structure.
customer_reviews.text: Kids like it to make sentences. Storage isn’t easy if the parts of speech are divided and grouped together for easy and quick use.
customer_reviews.author: G. Markum

customer_reviews.title: You have to buy it.
customer_reviews.text: What a great idea! As soon as I opened the box, 4 year old was ready to play. We played for a 1/2 hour straight. Love this game.
customer_reviews.author: Faye M. Davenport

customer_reviews.title: All age groups! Perfect gift!
customer_reviews.text: I start using this with my 3 years old baby. He loves to make sentences and enjoys a lot..... the sentences he make a are really silly and we laugh a lot! Good product. Reading and sentence making is so easy to teach your kid. I recommend this product for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Shahzeb

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Best game to help kiddos to read! After playing once, my 5 year old is starting to read the sentences all on her own!
customer_reviews.author: Kylie McKie

customer_reviews.title: My kids love using this Silly Sentence game once a week during school!
customer_reviews.text: My kids love using this Silly Sentence game once a week during school! It's an awesome learning game. I would highly recommend buying this to anyone with school aged kids that are currently learning to read and write!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. W

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: My autistic sons can’t stop laughing as they match those silly sentences
customer_reviews.author: designer

customer_reviews.title: who's very smart loves to play it with her parents
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old niece, who's very smart loves to play it with her parents. great gift for a child who has everything!
customer_reviews.author: Stuie

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Such a great product and value. My Kindergarteners love making these silly sentences. My only complaint is that I wish the box had compartments to organize the pieces better. My kids spend a lot of time trying to sift through all the pieces trying to find the word they want, which ends up being a big mess on the table and takes a long time to clean up. I have tried limiting the number of pieces I Iet them use at one time, but they always seem to be looking for the word I didn't put out!
customer_reviews.author: Laura A. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: My students love this puzzle
customer_reviews.text: My students love this puzzle. I hear a lot of laughter when they read the silly sentences. I just wish it was sturdier. I use it with first graders. They can be rough on cardboard puzzles. I think it will last one more year. I recommend it even if it might have to be bought again after a few years if it is used in a classroom.
customer_reviews.author: ASH

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: My students love using these to make silly sentences during centers.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: My 5 1/2 yr old granddaughter loves this and I ...
customer_reviews.text: My 5 1/2 yr old granddaughter loves this and I also used in my first grade class as a literacy center.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Floyd

customer_reviews.title: Great for English Learners
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product to use with several ESL students that I tutor. So far I have used it with K-5 students, and all have enjoyed it. Even my more advanced English language learners got a kick out of the silly sentences and as a teacher I appreciate that it reinforces parts of speech and articles which are sometimes challenging for these students. My only complaint is that the verbs are limited, but I think my advanced students could make a project out of creating their own puzzle pieces. All in all, a helpful tool for kids new to english.
customer_reviews.author: Magdar

customer_reviews.title: Reading Aid
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my granddaughter and she loves making silly sentences. She's learning and doesn't even realize it.
customer_reviews.author: ABS

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: A really fun game. My kids are 6 and 4 and need help making the sentences but they love reading them.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Wall

customer_reviews.title: Just two verbs in the box? Silly="ate"
customer_reviews.text: Very small variety of words- I even went back and checked the card punchouts to see if I accidentally received duplicates (I didn't.) plenty of nouns, but only two verbs and prepositions- not very silly. Kids had fun first time, bored the second.
customer_reviews.author: Colin J. Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Good learning tool. Just a lot of pieces to pick up
customer_reviews.text: Good learning tool. Just a lot of pieces to pick up
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Silly Sentences--- Excellent Learning Tool, but Somewhat Limited.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my four year old daughter and she loved it. I gave it a 4 star because it is somewhat limiting. Within minutes of the game she was asking for words like 'and' and 'I' which were not included. A great feature would be to have some blank tiles that you can add other words as your child uses it more. I am going to cut some cardboard pieces to supplement with the words that she needs.
customer_reviews.author: Shopaholic

customer_reviews.title: Cute game
customer_reviews.text: It needs more variety, especially with the verbs, but my 1st grader likes making long, crazy sentences with this game. It's a fun way to introduce or reinforce parts of speech. Also, I wish it had commas so those long sentences could be punctuated properly.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Doherty

customer_reviews.title: ... bought this for my ESL classes and I was disappointed that is does not include is/are (to be verb) ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my ESL classes and I was disappointed that is does not include is/are (to be verb) and for a beginners, its confusing. A good start!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy R. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, but NEED MORE VERBS and adjectives
customer_reviews.text: My son likes this game- it's pretty good, but could (easily) be so much better. There are a lot of nouns (good), but NEED MORE VERBS and adjectives. For some reason, there are a ton of "a's" and "the's" and periods- only need a few. There are only 4 verbs, repeated- would be so much better and more engaging with more verbs and adjectives (only 12- get old quick).
customer_reviews.author: CG

customer_reviews.title: Educational Puzzle That’s Fun
customer_reviews.text: Nice puzzle that promote reading, aid in speech review and laughter.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Diane

customer_reviews.title: Great for sight words
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this. My almost 5 year old son and I play every night and he's picking up sight words like crazy. I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a fun and easy way to get their child interested in reading.
customer_reviews.author: Brianne

customer_reviews.title: Good for second grade and above.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product. The cardboard puzzle pieces are heavy and durable if children keep them out of their mouths or let their dog have them. The color coding makes it easier for younger children to put the sentences together. My students spent a lot of time putting sentences together and stayed engrossed.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky Charms

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted, Just in time!
customer_reviews.text: That was quick and just in time for my 4 years old grandson's birthday gift. Great for tutoring and sentence writing practice. He loves puzzles, this one will help him practice reading and connecting words to make complete sentences. YES, "I win! win! win!. " A gift he and his parent will love and his teachers will appreciate!!!!
customer_reviews.author: sea

customer_reviews.title: GOOD GIFT ITEM
customer_reviews.text: GIVEN AS BIRTHDAY PRESENT TO GRANDCHILD WHO PLAYS WITH IT ALL THE TIME
customer_reviews.author: Sid

customer_reviews.title: My niece and I have the same issue. She’s ...
customer_reviews.text: My niece and I have the same issue. She’s 5. The puzzle pieces that connect them make it difficult to make any arrangement of words.
customer_reviews.author: Cade N.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for kiddos who struggle to understand what makes a ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for kiddos who struggle to understand what makes a complete sentence. The visuals and color coding is very helpful and can be used to differentiate.
customer_reviews.author: Rebeca S

customer_reviews.title: Common Sense
customer_reviews.text: My kid loves this. It is very child and mommy friendly.
customer_reviews.author: ada

customer_reviews.title: This game is fun and educational
customer_reviews.text: This game is fun and educational. bought it for my 7 yr old son who is in first grade. kind of have to change the rules up and get creative my 3rd grader who is on a 5th grade reading level has fun playing around with it, with us, but its to easy for her really. I would say kindergarten to maybe 2nd grade depending on reading level of the child.
customer_reviews.author: Chelse Widen

customer_reviews.title: This is a great center for my students
customer_reviews.text: This is a great center for my students. Helps them practice putting sentences together and helping them also learn their parts of speech.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great piece for play and learning
customer_reviews.text: we love playing with our son and helping him learn how to put sentences together.
customer_reviews.author: GTprivatebeach

customer_reviews.title: Makes learning fun
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I wish the puzzle pieces were a bit sturdier, but otherwise excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Six-year-old who is learning to read really enjoys just making ...
customer_reviews.text: Six-year-old who is learning to read really enjoys just making silly sentences on his own.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn H.

customer_reviews.title: Make your own.
customer_reviews.text: Not enough variety of adjectives or verbs to keep a child interested. Great nouns, and only 4-verbs and maybe 10 adjectives. Become repetitive very quickly. Good for a child learning sentence organization but not advanced enough for a 2nd grade reader.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Strom

customer_reviews.title: One of my FAVORITE classroom games/centers
customer_reviews.text: I teach special education and LOVE this game for the lower elementary students. It's great for oral language development, sentence structure, increasing vocabulary, and also supports those students who aren't quite reading yet. A fun and silly game, easy to use as a center or a reward game. There are enough pieces for a good 4-5 students to work on this at a time, as long as they each make one sentence and put back those pieces when they are done, and then exchange for new ones.
customer_reviews.author: AdrienneTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: My boys liked making funny sentences and it helped to teach them new words
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: DK games: Silly sentences
customer_reviews.text: Lots of fun while learning about sentence structure such as verbs, nouns, etc. which are colored coded. My 5 year old grandson picked it up on his own and started to make silly sentences on his own and laughing as he read them to me. A great way to supplement education in grades K-2 or 3
customer_reviews.author: luvgrdane

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: my little guy enjoys putting the words together but gets frustrated because the puzzle pieces are not made well and do not snap together easily or stay together.
customer_reviews.author: Sharyn

customer_reviews.title: They love making the sentences and illustrating them
customer_reviews.text: This product is a win with my kiddos. They love making the sentences and illustrating them. It will be much better if this product comes with an organizer that will help sorting and choosing the puzzles to make a sentence.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Some may enjoy this game, but our family has not.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for my son. He loves making silly ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son. He loves making silly sentences and I notice it helping him a lot on remembing the words A and The and all the other sight words.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla A

customer_reviews.title: ... random by drawing and we get a bunch of fun from it
customer_reviews.text: My family makes sentence at random by drawing and we get a bunch of fun from it, wish it had more words and was even more silly
customer_reviews.author: alexander g tomtschik

customer_reviews.title: Super helpful
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is learning to read and this is such a big help.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for classrooms
customer_reviews.text: My students absolutely love the silly sentences they can make with this activity. Great way to motivate students to write full sentences!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Carbone

customer_reviews.title: Worst product ever
customer_reviews.text: It's the worst product I had ever bought for my child. It was a waste of money and also time as I had to spend like 2 hours building the sentences by myself before I play with my daughter. The concept is good but the words included in the whole set are terrible selected. It's my 1st time writing a review as I got really mad wasting my time and money
customer_reviews.author: S. Zurita

customer_reviews.title: Terrific game!
customer_reviews.text: This is such fun for kids! They are learning words and learning about sentences in an entertaining way. High quality cardboard and ink.
customer_reviews.author: SMASH

customer_reviews.title: Sentence writing made fun!
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality product. I am a special education teacher, and I used this game to teach sentence writing. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: A. Fleming

customer_reviews.title: ... kindergartner and preschooler often and we all have a great time learning while playing
customer_reviews.text: Play this with my kindergartner and preschooler often and we all have a great time learning while playing. Definitely worth the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Cards are too small for younger children. Also, ...
customer_reviews.text: Cards are too small for younger children. Also, too many cards. this can be remedied by removing some of the cards and adding them as desired, but the cards are still too small.
customer_reviews.author: Belle

customer_reviews.title: Using in a first grade classroom
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my first grade classroom. Students really enjoy making sentences. They are learning how to make a good complete sentence in the process.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Center for Teachers or Home
customer_reviews.text: I use this in a center in my first grade class. The kids love making silly sentences and they don't even realize they're learning! I separate the word into parts of speech so it's excellent for teaching that as well.
customer_reviews.author: R. Adler

customer_reviews.title: Summer 2018 One will be in first grade next fall ...
customer_reviews.text: Summer 2018 One will be in first grade next fall and another in Kdg. Very appropriate for their ages.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a bit like "Mad Libs' only with puzzle pieces
customer_reviews.text: My pre-k child really enjoys this game. It's a bit like "Mad Libs' only with puzzle pieces.
customer_reviews.author: TH

customer_reviews.title: Something is missing
customer_reviews.text: Not as fun as I thought it would be. It's pretty difficult for the children and not as fun. But the quality is good, and at least it teaches the correct grammar.
customer_reviews.author: Michal Bloch

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this game. My 4 year old reads well so its a nice game for her. I like the fact that there is upper case and lower case articles. However there is no "an". I would also be happier if there were more verbs and prepositions. We made up more tenses on paper and created more sentences. I guess that could be level 2 for this game. But for early learners, this is an amazing game.
customer_reviews.author: vandana

customer_reviews.title: Great teaching tool!
customer_reviews.text: We don't actually play this as a game...we just use this as a tool to help my 5 year old learn about sentence structure and practice making sentences. One day we'll get around to playing this as a game as well.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Penelope

customer_reviews.title: Great game for kids
customer_reviews.text: I use this game at school with first and second graders. They love it, and it's a great way to get them using descriptive words, capitals and periods. It's also very durable. I've used the same game with 20+ kids for three years.
customer_reviews.author: R. Kane

customer_reviews.title: Great Game
customer_reviews.text: This is a very fun, engaging game that will have your child/children making sentences that they'll want to read. I purchased this as a game for my students to help them build fluency. They love it and so do I!
customer_reviews.author: KST

customer_reviews.title: Not sure that this is really worth the price. ...
customer_reviews.text: Not sure that this is really worth the price. You can only put together so many sentences and then that is it. Definitely needs more adjectives and verbs.
customer_reviews.author: Northwest Mom

customer_reviews.title: There are a lot of pieces to this activity!
customer_reviews.text: I love how easy it was to teach my students to use this activity.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda

customer_reviews.title: I love the concept behind the puzzles
customer_reviews.text: I love the concept behind the puzzles. My 3 year was able to identify the words easily. I just wish more words were inluded such as “is”.
customer_reviews.author: Bruchell

customer_reviews.title: It funny, my son 6 years old love it
customer_reviews.text: It funny, my son 6 years old love it :)
customer_reviews.author: Mateusz

customer_reviews.title: Very good product for teaching children to read and identify  simple words
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. My children love the interaction of putting the word puzzle togather while learning.
customer_reviews.author: Deressa Williams

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a great buy when you are home schooling or teaching your kids to read.
customer_reviews.author: S. Spikes

customer_reviews.title: ... at a friend's place with her kids and really loved it. I bought this one was a present ...
customer_reviews.text: First played this game at a friend's place with her kids and really loved it. I bought this one was a present for another little girl and that family too has really enjoyed playing the game. It is a great way to bring everyone in the family together and teach the kids some grammar too!
customer_reviews.author: Janaky Profile Name

customer_reviews.title: Fun  game
customer_reviews.text: My six year old grandson had so much fun making silly sentences that his dad who was in another room thought I was tickling him. However, it's not easily transportable because of all the different cards. I'm looking for containers to sort and keep the different card categories. it's a fun game and does encourage reading skills.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Mcdermott

customer_reviews.title: lots of fun.
customer_reviews.text: Can be used to help children learn to build sentences. lots of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Shaeffer

customer_reviews.title: Great puzzle for a classroom!
customer_reviews.text: I use this puzzle in my primary classroom. It is a great reinforcer of sentences and the kids have a lot of fun with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun learning game
customer_reviews.text: This is fun. I wish it had more choices for the verbs, but it is still a good buy. It helps kids learn the components of a sentence and makes it fun with pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Mom's Kitchen

customer_reviews.title: My kindergarten students that are good readers LOVE these puzzles
customer_reviews.text: My kindergarten students that are good readers LOVE these puzzles! I think I will be able to use them when I become a speech-language pathologist as well.
customer_reviews.author: Rsteele

customer_reviews.title: great learning tool
customer_reviews.text: This makes reading and making sentences fun for kids. There a lot of card/puzzle pieces in here.
customer_reviews.author: kateydid1

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for a family
customer_reviews.text: Gave this as a birthday gift to my 7 year old niece. She is the oldest of siblings ages 5, 3, 1. They are home-schooled and her mom was just as excited to receive this gift. I'm so glad learning time can be game time, too!
customer_reviews.author: die komponistin

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit my son had more fun popping the words out than forming sentences, so far, but we're enjoying it and it's fun to do together. Great idea for a game.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Me and my kindergardener like this game!
customer_reviews.text: My son enjoys making sentences with this game with me. We take turns then he laughs at the silly sentences. I would like to see some small changes with the sentence options. All in all though this is a great supplemental learning tool.
customer_reviews.author: Bless Yahweh

customer_reviews.title: Def recommend it
customer_reviews.text: The kids like using it and I think it’s a great addition to their schools
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Fadel

customer_reviews.title: Birthday Gift
customer_reviews.text: Our Godson loved the game and putting silly sentences together. We got together with him at a restaurant for dinner and it kept him entertained during the meal and afterwards as adults talked.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Hughes
